biblStruct.note: This paper explores the new, but sometimes problematic way in which Christians themselves try to find a place in the Iraqi political landscape, defining themselves as an ethnic minority rather than as a religious community (Church), a development sometimes criticized by the ecclesiastical authorities, though as we will see the distinction between “religious” and “ethnic” is rather fluid.
